metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2906 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An attacker can leverage this flaw to gradually erode available memory to the point where named crashes for lack of resources. Upon restart the attacker would have to begin again, but nevertheless there is the potential to deny service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2906` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.10
bind9-dnsutils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.10
bind9-host - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.10
bind9-libs - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.10
bind9-utils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.10
bind9utils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.10
dnsutils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.10
No subscription required
